subject: Creativity
title: The Tortured Artist Myth: Suffering Doesn't Create Art
description: A quick, practical guide to The Tortured Artist Myth: Suffering Doesn't Create Art.

hook.text: Van Gogh created art despite his mental illness, not because of it.

buildup.text: The 'tortured artist' trope romanticizes mental illness, suggesting suffering is necessary for great art.

discovery.text: A study of 1 million+ creatives found slightly higher rates of certain conditions â€” but their most productive periods.

twist.text: The myth discourages artists from seeking help. 'If I get better, will I lose my creativity?

climax.text: Beethoven, Woolf, and Plath created DESPITE suffering, not because of it.

punchline.text: Art doesn't need suffering. It needs safety, time, and health.
